alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue into this evening. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Bland and Tazewell. In southeast West Virginia, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...While the threat of flash flooding has ended, flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations continues. Flood waters will slowly recede through the remainder of the day. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 237 PM EDT, Widespread flash flooding occurred across portions of Mercer and Tazewell Counties, as well in the City of Bluefield in West Virginia. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bluestone River, Blacklick Creek, Bratton Branch, Brush Creek, Big Spring Branch and Beaver Branch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bluefield, Princeton, Rocky Gap, Camp Creek, Pocahontas and Bramwell. - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
